messages.subject: Re: summer clothes (was bedtime schedules)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Can you put some warmer clothes into a bag and carry them yourself? Then if she wants them, they re right there, and nobody has to go back inside,
messages.messageBody:
> My daughter, who's 4, always wants to wear summer clothes. I don't have a
> problem with that when we're in the house, although others do. I tell them
> if she's cold she'll put more clothes on. However, it's hard for me to let
> it go when we have to go outside. She doesn't want to take extra clothes.

Can you put some warmer clothes into a bag and carry them yourself? Then if
she wants them, they're right there, and nobody has to go back inside,
especially if they're big enough to go on over what she has.

> I guess I don't know to what extent do we bend over backwards to let our kids
> do whatever they want, without making our lives so difficult.

To the same extent I'd try to help anyone I loved do whatever they wanted,
even if it was sometimes difficult. I do try to find things that work as
smoothly as possible, and that does involve some really creative thinking
sometimes. Many of the handy ideas I put into use every day came right from
this list :) and others like it.

Pam
